shorts.title: Calligraphers Guild of NEPA 45th anniversary
shorts.description: The Calligraphers Guild of NEPA met recently to plan 45th anniversary workshops and events for the 2025-26 year. From left: Judy Jeanes, IT chair; Lisa Malos, historian; Debbie Dick, workshop chair; Margie Zaums, charter member; Melanie Lewis, exhibition chair; Mary Sadauckas, librarian; Pam Graff; and Stephanie Cavallaro, president. Anyone interested in learning about calligraphy may contact Stephanie Cavallaro at calligraphynepa@gmail.com. View the website at https://calligraphynepa.wixsite.com/northeastpa.
shorts.content: The Calligraphers Guild of NEPA met recently to plan 45th anniversary workshops and events for the 2025-26 year. From left: Judy Jeanes, IT chair; Lisa Malos, historian; Debbie Dick, workshop chair; Margie Zaums, charter member; Melanie Lewis, exhibition chair; Mary Sadauckas, librarian; Pam Graff; and Stephanie Cavallaro, president. Anyone interested in learning about calligraphy may contact Stephanie Cavallaro at calligraphynepa@gmail.com. View the website at https://calligraphynepa.wixsite.com/northeastpa.
shorts.content_distilled: Calligraphers Guild of NEPA met recently to plan 45th anniversary workshops and events for the 2025-26 year.

shorts.title: HS FOOTBALL: West Scranton snaps skid, builds excitement within program
shorts.title_distilled: HS FOOTBALL: West Scranton snaps skid, builds excitement within program.
shorts.description: Jake Manetti and his staff at West Scranton are building a program, but have battled to achieve the one key ingredient. Confidence. Returning players for the Invaders, despite losing all 10 games in 2024, found their way to the offseason conditioning and weight training sessions. They committed themselves to the program. In addition, they serve their community and represent the school and team with pride. On Friday, in the season opener, West Scranton earned a victory over Old Forge, 20-7, in a nonconference game. It is the reward for the work they put in to prepare for this fall. It […]
shorts.content: Jake Manetti and his staff at West Scranton are building a program, but have battled to achieve the one key ingredient. Confidence. Returning players for the Invaders, despite losing all 10 games in 2024, found their way to the offseason conditioning and weight training sessions. They committed themselves to the program. In addition, they serve their community and represent the school and team with pride. On Friday, in the season opener, West Scranton earned a victory over Old Forge, 20-7, in a nonconference game. It is the reward for the work they put in to prepare for this fall. It […]

shorts.title: Monday Update: Farmers market voucher numbers down in county

shorts.description: Lackawanna County's Area Agency on Aging distributed fewer vouchers this season after the value was cut by half and the agency got fewer vouchers than it requested

shorts.title: RailRiders top Buffalo to take series
shorts.title_distilled: RailRiders top Buffalo to take series.
shorts.description: Braden Shewmake hit a two-run single in the top of the eighth inning to break a tie game and lead the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders to a 5-3 victory over the Buffalo Bisons on Sunday at Sahlen Field. The RailRiders (36-15) took the series, 4-2, and lead the International League East second-half standings by three games over Syracuse, which travels to Scranton/Wilkes-Barre for a six-game set starting Tuesday. Riley Tirotta hit a two-run single in the third to give Buffalo a 2-0 lead. The Bisons added to their lead when Rainer Nunez scored on a Zach Messinger wild pitch. The RailRiders rallied […]
shorts.content: Braden Shewmake hit a two-run single in the top of the eighth inning to break a tie game and lead the Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders to a 5-3 victory over the Buffalo Bisons on Sunday at Sahlen Field. Riley Tirotta hit a two-run single in the third to give Buffalo a 2-0 lead. The Bisons added to their lead when Rainer Nunez scored on a Zach Messinger wild pitch. The RailRiders rallied […]
